label: 日陰蔓
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: [Hikage no] kazura [is] a term used in the Heian period to refer to long white or green braided cords made of silk or paper-mulberry bark, four of which were suspended as ornaments from either side of a Gosechi dancer's head (p. 289n). [五節]
